album_title: Words of Radiance: A Rock Opera — Act VI: Radiance
voice_instruct: A powerful rock vocalist with dramatic theatrical delivery, soaring range and emotional intensity, like a progressive rock frontman performing in a concept album

tracks.title: I Am Unity
tracks.voice_instruct: A deep, commanding male bass-baritone at his most transcendent, the voice breaking through mortal limits into something divine, from anguished whisper to earth-shaking declaration
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, climactic symphonic rock, all three motifs resolving — distorted industrial Thrill riff dissolving chromatically into silence, Honor's Theme hymn-like major key melody ascending to full-throated choir unison, rising chromatic stormwall motif transforming into triumphant fanfare, massive orchestral arrangement with full choir, transcendent male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, THE climax of the entire opera, perpendicularity opening
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
"Give me your pain," the god of hatred said,
And I was on my knees, the world in red,
The Rift, my wife, the fire, every sin,
The Thrill demanding that I let it in.

[verse 2]
But I remember now, I remember her,
Evi, gentle, kind, a truth I tried to blur,
Cultivation gave my memories their price,
And now I pay it, standing on the ice.

[chorus]
You cannot have my pain, it's mine to bear,
The most important step is the next one there,
I am not the Blackthorn, I am something new,
And the most important words: I will do better, too.

[bridge]
I am Unity!
The sky cracks open, perpendicularity,
Honor's Theme in full-throated choir, ascending free,
The Thrill dissolves, the riff deconstructs to air,
The stormwall turns to fanfare, bright and fair,
I hold the realms together with my hands,
Stormlight floods the field, the army stands.

[verse 3]
The Fused recoil, Odium pulls away,
"No," he screams, "this was not meant to be the way,"
But a Bondsmith's oath is stronger than a god,
And I am Unity, upon this bloodied sod.

[outro]
I am Unity, I am the words I speak,
The strongest man is he who dares be weak,
The perpendicularity shines gold,
And Dalinar, at last, is finally whole.

tracks.title: Nightblood
tracks.voice_instruct: A haunted, controlled male tenor with Middle Eastern inflections, encountering something beyond his comprehension, awe and horror mixed with dark fascination
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, dark progressive metal with reversed distorted industrial Thrill riff played backward, Honor's Theme entering on same industrial distorted instruments — redemption through corruption's tools, Nightblood's hum as subsonic drone, heavy male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the inversion motif
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
A black sword in a silver sheath, it hums,
"Would you like to destroy some evil?" it comes,
The voice like a child who doesn't understand,
That evil is a thing too vast to brand.

[verse 2]
Nale gives it, says, "You've earned a second blade,
The Skybreaker's justice, by your hands displayed,"
I draw it, and the world goes black around,
Investiture consumed without a sound.

[chorus]
Nightblood, Nightblood, singing in my grip,
A weapon on the edge of madness' tip,
The Thrill plays backward, violence undone,
And in its place, a terrifying sun.

[bridge]
The Thrill reversed, the industrial riff played back,
Then Honor's Theme on distorted strings, a crack
In the universe, redemption through the blade,
The truthless given power, the murderer unmade.

[verse 3]
"Destroy!" it screams, and I must hold it tight,
A weapon darker than the darkest night,
But Szeth chose Dalinar, his highest law,
And Nightblood serves the oath without a flaw.

[outro]
The sword sings evil, but the hand holds true,
And Szeth-son-Vallano starts his life anew.

tracks.title: Szeth Reborn
tracks.voice_instruct: A haunted, controlled male tenor finally finding hope, Middle Eastern inflections warming from cold precision to tentative joy, the voice of a dead man learning to live
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, redemptive progressive rock with Honor's Theme growing from tentative to trumpet blast, rising chromatic stormwall motif as Szeth flies into battle, soaring arrangement, male vocals gaining strength, concept album continuity, theatrical, resurrection and purpose
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
They killed me, and I died upon the storm,
A Truthless man who'd outlived his own form,
But Nale brought me back, a second breath,
And Szeth-son-Vallano returned from death.

[verse 2]
I choose Dalinar Kholin as my law,
The man who speaks of honor without flaw,
My Skybreaker ideal, my guiding star,
The Bondsmith who would heal the deepest scar.

[chorus]
Szeth reborn, the stone is lifted free,
The truthless man discovers what "truth" can be,
Not orders, not the oathstone's heavy chain,
But a choice to fly, a choice to end the pain.

[bridge]
Honor's melody, I hear it now, at last,
It grows from whisper to a trumpet's blast,
The stormwall carries me on winds of white,
And Szeth, the assassin, learns to fight for right.

[verse 3]
Nightblood hums against my back, a friend,
The strangest, deadliest ally to the end,
Together we descend on Thaylen's field,
A living weapon with a broken shield.

[outro]
Szeth rises, white against the dark,
A Skybreaker carrying Honor's spark.

tracks.title: The Assassin's Redemption
tracks.voice_instruct: A haunted male tenor fully transformed, Middle Eastern inflections now carrying pride and conviction, the voice of a man who has found his purpose at last
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, triumphant battle rock with Honor's Theme inverted then resolved — played backward then resolving forward on full orchestra, rising chromatic stormwall motif as battle glory, aerial combat energy, powerful male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, redemption completed
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The Fused descend on Thaylen Field like rain,
And I descend to meet them, born again,
Nightblood blazing, consuming light and form,
I am the calm inside the raging storm.

[verse 2]
I Lash the sky, I walk upon the air,
The Assassin in White, but the white I wear
Is no longer shame, it is a Skybreaker's coat,
And every kill I make is Dalinar's vote.

[chorus]
The assassin's redemption, written in the sky,
The man who killed a king now learns to fly
For something greater than an oathstone's word,
For a Bondsmith's unity, the truest I have heard.

[bridge]
Honor's Theme inverted, backward, wrong,
Then slowly, note by note, it rights the song,
The same melody that Kaladin once swore,
Now Szeth carries it, forevermore.

[verse 3]
The battle rages, Nightblood drinks its fill,
But I am Szeth, I am the master's will,
Not truthless, not a weapon, not a shame,
A Skybreaker who chose to speak his name.

[outro]
The stormwall parts for Szeth-son-Vallano's flight,
The assassin, redeemed, ascending into light.

tracks.title: Maya
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, youthful male tenor filled with wonder and fierce protective love, the voice of a man whose faith in something impossible is vindicated, breaking with emotion at the climax
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, emotionally devastating progressive rock with broken Honor's Theme dissonant note finally resolving into pure harmony, Maya's scream as a raw orchestral hit cutting through silence, building from courtroom tension to cathartic release, emotional male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the dead spren speaks
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
They put the Radiants on trial, the living dead,
The honorspren point fingers at what was said
And broken, oaths discarded, bonds betrayed,
"You killed your spren!" the prosecution weighed.

[verse 2]
My Blade is in the court, a prop, a proof,
A deadeye spren beneath Shadesmar's roof,
Ten thousand years of silence, ten of pain,
And every Radiant on trial again.

[chorus]
Then Maya speaks, a scream that shakes the hall,
"We! Chose!" she cries, and silences them all,
The spren chose too, they chose to break the bond,
Not murdered, not abandoned, they were fond
Enough to share the cost, to pay the toll,
Two broken halves of one connected soul.

[bridge]
The honor note, dissonant for so long,
Finally resolves, the broken becomes song,
Maya's voice, a melody restored,
The Shardblade screams and heals the fractured chord.

[verse 3]
Adolin holds his Blade and feels her stir,
Not dead, not quite, a ghost becoming her,
"I hear you," he whispers, "I have always heard,"
And Maya, Maya speaks her second word.

[outro]
We chose, she said, and the world remembers why,
Even broken things deserve another try.

tracks.title: The Weight of Command
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, youthful male tenor stripped of swagger and filled with quiet conviction, the voice of a man who knows he is ordinary among gods and chooses to stand anyway
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, human-scale rock anthem with Honor's Theme on mortal acoustic instruments — no choir, no Stormlight effects, just guitar and drums and heart, rising chromatic stormwall motif as battle backdrop, honest and unadorned male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the human hero
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
No Stormlight runs in me, no oaths I've sworn,
No nahel bond, no spren to keep me warm,
I am a man with Plate and Blade and will,
And that, my friends, is more than plenty still.

[verse 2]
The Radiants glow and fly and move like light,
Kaladin streaks across the battlefield tonight,
But I'm down here, boots in blood and mud,
Leading soldiers forward through the flood.

[chorus]
The weight of command, no magic, just the trust
Of people who believe because they must,
In something human, something they can see,
A prince who bleeds the same as you and me.

[bridge]
Honor's melody, but played on mortal strings,
No choir, no Stormlight, just the song that sings
When ordinary people choose to stand,
A human heart, a steady human hand.

[verse 3]
Maya pulses in my grip, still waking, still,
Not alive, not dead, somewhere between, until
The day she fully speaks, I'll hold her tight,
A mortal prince, his blade, the long goodnight.

[outro]
Adolin charges, human, proud, and true,
The weight of command, and he will see it through.

tracks.title: The Scholar's War
tracks.voice_instruct: A commanding, precise female mezzo-soprano unleashed as a weapon of mass destruction, intellectual authority turned to devastating force, controlled fury
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, weaponized progressive rock with Honor's Theme as battle hymn — the scholar's oath becoming a war cry on full orchestra and aggressive choir, rising chromatic stormwall motif as battle chaos, Soulcasting sound design with matter-transformation effects, powerful female vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the scholar fights
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
They think a scholar cannot hold a line,
They think my weapon's ink and not divine,
But Ivory stands with me, my spren of truth,
And I Soulcast their armies proof by proof.

[verse 2]
The air becomes fire, stone becomes the void,
Each Fused that charges me is simply toyed
With, matter bending to the scholar's will,
The heretic queen upon Thaylen's hill.

[chorus]
The scholar's war is waged with different arms,
Not ignorance but knowledge does the harm,
I speak the truths that reshape what is real,
And the enemy learns how a scholar makes them kneel.

[bridge]
Honor's melody becomes a battle hymn,
The scholar's oath now sung in voices grim,
I will not turn from truth, I will not break,
And every life I take is for truth's sake.

[verse 3]
Smoke and crystal, flesh and flame,
I am Jasnah Kholin, remember my name,
The woman who walked Shadesmar alone,
Now turns a battlefield to dust and bone.

[outro]
The scholar's war is never truly done,
But tonight we fight beneath a burning sun.

tracks.title: Words of Radiance
tracks.voice_instruct: All six voices converging — male baritone, male bass-baritone, male tenor, female soprano, female mezzo-soprano, youthful male tenor — building to unified choir, the voice of all Roshar singing together
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, grand symphonic finale combining all three motifs resolved — Honor's Theme dominant in full choir unison, dissolved Thrill leaving peaceful silence, Stormwall motif as triumphant resolution ascending to final chord, full orchestra with choir, all six character vocal timbres converging, concept album continuity, theatrical, THE FINALE of the entire 48-track opera, cathartic and triumphant
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The battle fades, the Everstorm withdraws,
And on Thaylen Field we stand without a pause,
Dalinar glowing, perpendicularity sealed,
The Bondsmith's oath across the broken field.

[verse 2]
Kaladin lands, his Bridge Four crew in tow,
Szeth sheathes Nightblood, its hungry afterglow,
Shallan stands as Shallan, masks laid down,
And Adolin, the human, wears no crown
But loyalty, which cannot be unmade,
And Jasnah, queen and scholar, sheathes her blade.

[chorus]
Words of radiance, spoken in the dark,
Each one an oath, each one a living spark,
"I will protect," and "I am unity,"
"We chose," and "Truth," the words that set us free,
This is the opera of broken things made whole,
The stormlight burning in every single soul.

[bridge]
Honor's Theme, full choir, the final stand,
Every voice together, every hand,
The Thrill is gone, dissolved to quiet air,
The Stormwall parts to show the dawn is there,
Rising, rising, chromatic phrase resolved,
Every mystery, every pain, dissolved
Into the light of Radiance, the glow,
Of people who refused to let hope go.

[verse 3]
The war continues, Odium still waits,
The Fused will return, will test the gates,
But tonight, on Thaylen's blood-soaked sand,
The Knights Radiant have made their stand.

[outro]
Journey before destination, strength before weakness,
Life before death, these are the words of Radiance,
And we will speak them, again and again,
Until the last storm passes, until the end.
